description: The application is for rezoning at 8120 and 8140 No. 1 Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone to the “Low Density Townhouses (RTL4)” Zone. The proposal is to develop nine townhouse units with vehicle access from No. 1 Road. The existing dwellings on the subject site are proposed to be demolished. The surrounding development consists of single-family dwellings and townhouses. The Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject properties is “Neighbourhood Residential”, and the Arterial Road Land Use Policy designation is “Arterial Road Townhouse”, subject to specific development criteria. The redevelopment proposal is consistent with these designations. The redevelopment proposal involves land assembly with a frontage less than 50 m on No. 1 Road, but staff support the application due to efforts made to acquire adjacent properties, financial feasibility, and submission of a preliminary concept plan for future redevelopment with shared vehicle access.

behalf: 1303287 B.C. Ltd. (Balraj Singh Sanghera and Rajbir Kaur Chatha)
description: Rezoning of 11831/11833 Seabrook Crescent from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' zone to 'Single Detached (RS2/B)' zone to permit subdivision into two single-family lots, each with vehicle access from Seabrook Crescent.

The applicant wants to rezone 10511 Lassam Road from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone, to permit the property to be subdivided to create two single-family lots with access from Lassam Road.

The purpose of the rezoning is to permit the construction of a mixed-use development with a 6-storey commercial/residential podium and a 17-storey apartment tower with underground parking, and a bus layover facility.

An OCP Amendment from 'Urban' to 'Multiple Residential' and to allow higher floor area ratio (FAR) within the 'Multiple Residential' designation. Rezoning from RM-M to CD. Development Permit to permit the development of 20 apartment buildings, some with ground floor commercial space. A Bylaw was introduced to amend Official Community Plan (OCP), Figure 3: General Land Use Designations from 'Urban' to 'Multiple Residential' and amend Table 7A: Land Use Designation Exceptions within the 'Multiple Residential' designation by adding site specific permission for the subject site 7790 King George Boulevard to permit a density up to 2.75 FAR (Block 4), 2.35 FAR (Block 5), and 2.48 FAR (Block 6), and for subject site 7850 King George Boulevard to permit a density up to 2.78 FAR (Block 1), 2.79 FAR (Block 2), and 2.45 FAR (Block 3), and a date for Public Hearing be set. Council also determined the opportunities for consultation with persons, organizations and authorities that are considered to be affected by the proposed amendment to the OCP. A Bylaw was introduced to rezone a portion of the subject site as shown as Block 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 from 'Manufactured Home Residential Zone (RM-M)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)' and a date be set for Public Hearing. Council authorized staff to draft General Development Permit Nos. 7922-0221-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings, and the finalized Ecosystem Development Plan and geotechnical report. Council instructed staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption.

description: Rezoning from RF to RF-13 and Development Permit for Hazard Lands (Steep Slope) / Development Variance Permit for 12538 Old Yale Road. The Development Variance Permit allows subdivision into 2 single family small lots. The Bylaw to rezone the subject site from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Single Family Residential (13) Zone (RF-13)' was introduced and a date was set for Public Hearing. Development Variance Permit No. 7922-0352-00 was approved, varying several setbacks and lot depth requirements for proposed Lot 1. Council instructed staff to resolve various issues prior to final adoption, including engineering requirements, tree preservation, geotechnical report, and noise mitigation measures. A resolution was passed to amend the South Westminster Neighbourhood Concept Plan to redesignate the subject site from 'Parks and Open Spaces' to 'Urban Residential' when the project is considered for final adoption.

OCP Amendment from 'Commercial' to 'Multiple Residential', NCP Amendment from 'High Rise Residential' and 'High Rise Mixed Use' to 'Low to Mid Rise Residential', Rezoning from C-35 to CD (based on RM-70), Development Permit to permit the development of two, 6-storey apartment buildings with approximately 192 dwelling units and underground parking in Guildford.

Rezoning from RA to RF and Development Variance Permit for 13357 - 62 Avenue. The permit allows subdivision into 2 single family lots. Specific variances for lot width and side yard setbacks. Issues to be resolved include engineering requirements, tree preservation, affordable housing strategy, and demolition of existing buildings and structures.

Amend OCP Figure 3: General Land Use Designations for the subject site from 'Mixed Employment' to 'Multiple Residential'; amend OCP Figure 42: Major Employment Areas for the subject site by removing the 'Mixed Employment' designation for the subject site; amend OCP Table 7a: Land Use Designation Exceptions within the 'Multiple Residential' designation by adding site specific permission for the subject sies to permit a density up to 2.5 FAR; rezone the subject site from 'Single Family Residential Zone (RF)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)'; draft Development Permit No. 7922-0218-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I), and the finalized geotechnical report.

description: Rezoning a portion of the site from RM-45 to CD (based on RM-70) and Development Permit / Development Variance Permit to permit the development of an infill 5-storey residential apartment building, containing 45 dwelling units over 2 levels of underground parking, as well as 7, three-storey townhouse units, on a portion of the site. A Bylaw be introduced to rezone the portion of the subject site shown as Block 2 on the attached Survey Plan (Appendix I), from 'Multiple Residential 45 Zone (RM-45)' to 'Comprehensive Development Zone (CD)', and a date for Public Hearing be set. Council authorize staff to draft Development Permit No. 7921-0357-00 generally in accordance with the attached drawings (Appendix I). Council approve Development Variance Permit No. 7921-0357-00, varying the minimum off-street parking requirements of Part 5 of the Zoning Bylaw from 70 parking spaces to 50 parking spaces, resolution of all urban design issues, submission of a finalized landscaping plan and landscaping cost estimate, submission of a finalized tree survey and a statement regarding tree preservation, provision of cash-in-lieu contribution to satisfy the indoor amenity space requirement of the RM-70 Zone, registration of a modified shared access easement, submission of an acoustical report for the units adjacent to 100 Avenue, and registration of a Section 219 Restrictive Covenant to adequately address the City’s needs with respect to public art, to the satisfaction of the General Manager, Parks, Recreation and Culture and with respect to the City’s Affordable Housing Strategy and Tier 1 Capital Project CACs, to the satisfaction of the General Manager, Planning & Development Services.
To subdivide the site into two single family residential lots
To develop a 3,500 square metre industrial building.
Rezoning from C-4 to C-5 to permit a Child Care Centre within an existing commercial building.
Development of a 5-storey, 72-unit, mid-rise residential building over one level of underground parking on a consolidated site in Cloverdale Town Centre.

A rezoning application has been received for a mixed-use development with two six-storey buildings and 85 residential units. The maximum potential density for the site is 3.025 FAR. The development site is located along Kingsway and Grimmer Street and is designated for medium density mixed-use development in the Royal Oak Community Plan.

A rezoning application has been received for a high-density mixed-tenure residential development with commercial/retail podium and underground parking. The development plan includes two high-rise residential apartment buildings with commercial/retail podium and underground parking. Vehicle access is proposed through a temporary street across 1934 Gilmore Avenue and will also be provided from 4199 Lougheed Highway once it is redeveloped. Pedestrian access is provided from Lougheed Highway and a future east-west street. The development will be constructed in a single phase, involving demolishing the existing warehouse and surface parking and constructing a 62-storey residential strata building (Building A) in the northeast corner and a 54-storey residential market and non-market rental building (Building B) in the southwest corner. Both buildings sit atop a 10-storey commercial podium that includes a hotel(s) and retail units. The commercial podium can be used for offices or other employment generating uses if the hotel market softens in the future.

zoning.newZoningDescription: Comprehensive Development District based on RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, C3 General Commercial District, and the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan

description: Rezoning application for the construction of a high-rise residential building with commercial space and underground parking at 2211 and 2271 Rosser Avenue. The subject site is approximately 4,333 m2 and currently improved with industrial units and a residential sales centre. The proposed development is designated for medium to high-density development under the Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan. The plan includes high-density mixed-use development in the RM4, RM4s, RM4r, and C9 Districts. The addition of the C3 District designation is supported to allow for the development of a hotel on the site, which will complement the existing and potential future development in the area. The applicant has submitted a suitable plan of development for presentation at a Public Hearing. Council is recommended to authorize the introduction of a Housing Agreement Bylaw, a Highway Closure Bylaw, approve the sale of City-owned property for inclusion within the development site, prepare a Rezoning Bylaw for First Reading, and establish prerequisites for the completion of the rezoning.

zoning.newZoningDescription: high-density mixed-use development with potential for hotel

description: Rezoning application received for the construction of two mid-rise residential buildings with underground parking. The proposed development plan includes two six-storey midrise residential buildings with an internal courtyard, amenity spaces, and underground parking. Demolition of existing site improvements and replacement with two buildings totaling 257 rental residential dwelling units. The development offers a modern aesthetic, inclusive design, street-level unit access, shared amenity spaces, and communal courtyard. It provides a range of housing types including studios, one-bedroom units, and family-oriented units such as three-bedroom and den units, and three-bedroom townhouses. The subject proposal exemplifies high quality urban design and architectural expression related to building's siting, massing, pedestrian orientation, and materiality.

Construction of a high-rise commercial rental residential apartment building in accordance with the Brentwood Site Conceptual Master Plan and associated Development Guidelines. The proposed rezoning is based on the C3 General Commercial District and Brentwood Town Centre Plan as guidelines.

reportUrls.title: REZ 22-36 Commercial Rental Tower VII PH Report -2023-10-30.pdf

address: Lougheed Highway between Bainbridge Avenue and Sperling Avenue
description: Rezoning application received for the construction of two mid-rise strata apartment buildings, a commercial podium, and a mid-rise market and rental building in accordance with Phase 1A of the Burnaby Lake Village Conceptual Master Plan. The subject site comprises Phase 1A of the Master Plan, including various buildings and amenities. Two new north-south streets and one new east-west street will be created. The Phase 1A site is located on the south side of Lougheed Highway between Bainbridge Avenue and Sperling Avenue. The site is designated for high-density mixed-use development. The net Phase 1A site is approximately 9,564 m2 in size. The site currently has an industrial building with surface parking.

description: Rezoning at 7300 St. Albans Road from 'Single Detached (RS1/E)' Zone to 'High Density Townhouses (RTH1)' Zone. The applicant wants to build high-density townhouses with a minimum of 20 units per acre.

Hari Singh Gill has applied to rezone the property at 3300 Granville Avenue from the “Single Detached (RS1/E)” zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/B)” zone to allow the property to be subdivided into two single-family lots. The proposed subdivision plan is shown in Attachment 2. The rezoning and subdivision proposed in this application is consistent with the Lot Size Policy 5447. The proposed rezoning and subdivision application is consistent with the Official Community Plan (OCP) land use designation for the subject property, which is “Neighbourhood Residential” (NRES). The proposed redevelopment must meet the requirements of the Richmond Flood Plain Designation and Protection Bylaw 8204. There is an existing Statutory Right-of-Way (SRW) for the City in the rear yard for sanitary sewer services. The applicant is proposing to rezone the subject site and subdivide into two single-family lots, each with a one bedroom secondary suite. The existing driveway will be removed and new driveways will be constructed through a Servicing Agreement as detailed in the Site Servicing and Frontage Improvements sub-section of this report. The applicant has submitted a Certified Arborist’s Report; which identifies on-site and off-site tree species, assesses tree structure and condition, and provides recommendations on tree retention and removal relative to the proposed development. The City’s Tree Preservation Coordinator has reviewed the Arborist’s Report and supports the Arborist’s findings.

address: 5471 Steveston Highway, 5491/5493 Steveston Highway, 5531 Steveston Highway, 5551 Steveston Highway, 5571 Steveston Highway, 5591 Steveston Highway, 5595 Steveston Highway, 5611/5613 Steveston Highway
description: The applicant wants to rezone the mentioned addresses from “Single Detached (RS1/B)” Zone, “Single Detached (RS1/E)” Zone and “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” Zone to “Medium Density Townhouses (RTM2)” Zone in order to build medium density townhouses. Staff Recommendation: That Richmond Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 10496, for the rezoning of the mentioned addresses to the “Medium Density Townhouses (RTM2)” zone, be introduced and given first reading.

The applicant, on behalf of Kennon Construction, is applying for rezoning at 10840/10860 Bonavista Gate from the “Two-Unit Dwellings (RD1)” Zone to the “Single Detached (RS2/C)” Zone. The proposed development includes the construction of single detached homes with a minimum lot size of 5000 square feet and a maximum building height of 35 feet.

applicant: Mania Hormozi, CLT 0012 Community Society, 220-1651 Commercial Drive, Vancouver, BC, V5L 3Y3
description: Proposed rezoning bylaw amendment aims to establish development guidelines for subject site to facilitate non-market housing development. Subject site measures approximately 0.81 hectares and is located within Sub-Area 3 of Edmonds Town Centre Plan. Subject site, together with larger site to southwest, forms "Bevan Lands" development site. Council advanced program in 2019 to bring forward City-owned sites, including subject site, for non-market housing development. Previous rezoning application (REZ #19-59) established development guidelines for subject site. Public Hearing report for subject site (REZ #20-17) submitted in 2020, outlining detailed development for non-market co-operative buildings. CLT was not successful in obtaining BC Housing's Community Housing Fund at that time. BC Housing announced funding for subject site in 2023, allowing for cooperative housing project with up to 118 housing units. Council referred previous report back to explore opportunities for additional density and non-market housing units on subject site. Revised report provides updated CD Guidelines with changes to height, density, and parking rates to facilitate potential for additional units. City staff currently exploring option of adding additional units to proposed development in coordination with BC Housing and CLT. Finalized density and request for City housing grant will be subject of future Council report.

description: The rezoning request is to change the zoning from General Agriculture Zone to Business Park 1 Zone in order to develop a 9,226 square metres multi-tenant industrial building. Additionally, a Development Variance Permit is requested to reduce the minimum rear yard (north) setback from 7.5 metres to 0 metres to the principal building face.

The applicant is requesting to rezone the subject site from Single Family Residential Zone to Multiple Residential 30 Zone in order to permit the development of 11 townhouse units in Cloverdale Town Centre. In addition, the proposal includes a Development Variance Permit to reduce various minimum yard setbacks and indoor amenity space requirements, permit parking within the required setback, and locate the outdoor amenity space within the required setback.

The applicant, 1364301 B.C. Ltd., is requesting to rezone the site at 6075 - 144 Street from One-Acre Residential Zone to Multiple Residential 30 Zone in order to develop 29 townhouse units. The proposal also includes a Development Variance Permit to reduce the minimum side yard on flanking lane setback (north) from 4.5 metres to 4.2 metres to the principal building face for Unit 29 (Building 9); and to reduce the minimum side yard setback (south) from 6.0 metres to 3.1 metres to the principal building face for Units 14, 15, 23 and 24 (Buildings 4, 5, 7 and 8).

The proposal includes rezoning the site from Single Family Residential Zone to Comprehensive Development Zone in order to develop a 6-storey apartment building with approximately 102 dwelling units and underground parking on a consolidated site in Guildford.

description: To rezone 3529-3589 Arbutus Street and 2106 West 19th Avenue from R1-1 (Residential) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) District, to permit the development of a five-storey rental building. A height of 16.8 m (55 ft.) and a floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.40 are proposed.

behalf: James Stephen Lebedovich and Silse Eileen Lebedovich, Joanne Wong
description: To rezone 6065-6075 Collingwood Place from R1-1 (Residential) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) District, to permit the development of a five-storey rental building. A height of 16.8 m (55 ft.) and a floor space ratio (FSR) of 2.40 are proposed.

description: To rezone 5515-5525 Elizabeth Street from R1-1 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of a four-storey residential building with a partial 5th floor rooftop amenity area with 27 strata-titled residential units. A floor space ratio of 2.0 and a maximum building height of 13.7 m (45 ft.) with additional height to 18.2 m (60 ft.) for a rooftop amenity and mechanical appurtenances are proposed.

To rezone 1510 West 71st Avenue and 8733 Granville Street from C-2 (Commercial) District and RM-3A (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of a six-storey mixed-use building, with commercial space at-grade and 74 secured market rental units. A height of 22.0 m (72 ft.) and a floor space ratio (FSR) of 3.38 are proposed.

To rezone 430-440 West Pender Street from DD (Downtown) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of a 12-storey mixed-use building with a partial 13th floor rooftop amenity area, with commercial at-grade and 80 secured market rental housing units. A floor space ratio (FSR) of 8.42 and a maximum building height of 32.0 m (105 ft.) with additional height to 35.1 m (115 ft.) for a partial 13th floor rooftop common amenity space are proposed.

behalf: Anthem Fraser Developments Ltd., Mercer Properties (Fraser 17) Inc.
description: To rezone 3231-3245 Fraser Street and 675 East 17th Avenue from C-2 (Commercial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to permit the development of a 14-storey mixed-use building with a partial 15th floor rooftop amenity area, with commercial at-grade and 110 secured rental housing units, of which 20% of the residential floor area will be secured as moderate income units, over three levels of underground parking. A floor space ratio of 6.9 and a maximum building height of 45.5 m (149 ft.) with additional height to 47.5 m (156 ft.) for a partial 15th floor rooftop amenity area are proposed.

behalf: Mosaic Flora and Fauna Holdings Ltd.
description: The application by Mosaic Homes, on behalf of Mosaic Flora and Fauna Holdings Ltd., the registered owner of the land located at 4711-4787 Cambie Street to rezone from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the permitted floor space ratio (FSR) from 0.70 to 2.65 and the maximum building height from 11.5 m (37.7 ft.) to 23.6 m (77.4 ft.) to permit the development of two six-storey residential buildings with 114 strata-titled residential units, be approved in principle.

This report recommends a plan amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) District, for the site located at 2231-2247 East 41st Avenue. The amendment would allow for a five-storey rental building in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy (“SRP”). An estimated total of 61 secured rental units would be delivered through this application. A future building design would be submitted through the development permit process and reviewed with the public at that time.

The applicant, AVRP Architecture Inc. on behalf of Pius Ho, the registered owner of the lands located at 6470 Larch Street, is requesting to rezone the lands from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to RR-2B (Residential Rental) District. The proposed development includes building a residential rental complex with a total of 50 units and 20 parking spaces.
The application proposes an 18-storey mixed-use building containing 191 social housing units, including six live-work units, and ground floor commercial space.

The rezoning application is to rezone the lands from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 0.70 to 2.88 and the maximum building height from 11.5 m (38 ft.) to 20.7 m (68 ft.), to permit the development of two six-storey residential buildings containing 146 secured-rental units, of which five units will be secured as below-market rental units.

The subject site at 692 West 30th Avenue is approximately 746.2 sq. m (8,032 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 17.1 m (56 ft.) along 30th Avenue and a depth of 43.8 m (144 ft.) along the east property line. The proposed rezoning is in alignment with the Vancouver Plan and the Cambie Corridor Plan, which guides the transformation of the Corridor into an area where people can live, work, shop, play and learn. The site is located within the Queen Elizabeth neighbourhood, characterized by its existing low-density residential character and green park-like setting.

The proposed amendment would rezone the property from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to RM-8A (Residential) District to allow for a townhouse or rowhouse development. The maximum floor space ratio (FSR) for RM-8A can be up to 1.20. Based on the site area, approximately eight townhouses can be achieved at this location.

The application is to rezone the lands from R1-1 (Residential Inclusive) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 0.70 to 3.87 and the maximum building height from 11.5 m (37.7 ft.) to 27.5 m (90 ft.) and to 31.5 m (103 ft.) for the portion with rooftop amenity, to permit the development of a six-storey, 162-unit Community Care Facility – Class B.

The application is to rezone the lands at 848 Seymour Street from DD (Downtown) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District, to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 5.75 to 17.67 and the maximum building height from 91.4 m (300 ft.) to 97.7 m (321 ft.), to permit the development of a 30-storey hotel.

The applicant wants to rezone the four parcels containing a surface parking lot on Seymour Street, with a site size of 1,253.1 sq. m (13,488 sq. ft.), frontage of 34.4 m (113 ft.) along Seymour Street and a depth of 36.6 m (120 ft). The site is located in the Central Business District (CBD) and surrounding sites contain residential, commercial and arts, culture and entertainment uses. Nearby developments range in height from five to 43 storeys, with three residential towers on this block.
